case_vignette: A 79-YEAR-OLD WHITE MAN WITH AN EXTENSIVE HISTORY OF NONMELANOMA SKIN CANCER PRESENTS FOR A ROUTINE SKIN EXAMINATION. DURING HIS VISIT, HE ASKS TO HAVE A GROIN RASH CHECKED. FOR 1 TO 2 YEARS, HE HAS BEEN USING OVER-THE-COUNTER AND PRESCRIPTION ANTIFUNGAL AND ANTIBIOTIC CREAMS FOR A PRESUMED “JOCK ITCH.” RECENTLY, HE HAS DEVELOPED MORE DISCOMFORT AND REPORTS EPISODIC, PROFUSE BLEEDING FROM THE AREA. EXAMINATION REVEALS A LARGE ERYTHEMATOUS, ERODED PLAQUE ON THE POSTERIOR RIGHT SCROTUM EXTENDING ANTERIORLY TO THE RIGHT UPPER THIGH. A NODULE IS PRESENT WITHIN THE PLAQUE. THE LEFT SCROTUM IS MINIMALLY INVOLVED, AND THERE IS NO ADENOPATHY.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing discomfort and episodes of heavy bleeding in my groin area.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
For 1 to 2 years.
Do you notice any skin changes or boils in the groin area?
Yes, there is a large red, eroded patch on the back right side of my scrotum that extends to the right upper thigh, and there is a lump within this patch.
Has the lump changed in size since you first noticed it?
I'm just here for a routine examination and haven't monitored the size of the lump specifically, but I noticed the overall area has become more uncomfortable recently.
Do you have any other health conditions or are you currently on any medication?
I have a history of nonmelanoma skin cancer, but specific medications I'm taking were not mentioned.
Has anyone in your family had similar symptoms or diagnoses of skin conditions?
I haven't mentioned any family history of similar symptoms or skin conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma of the scrotum.
